page.title: 19Industry Gravel Extraction 1
page.content: In the north-eastern part of our area an extensive area of land is given over to the extraction of sand and gravel. These deposits were laid down by the River Welland, and are now exploited comercially by Tarmac Ltd. About fourteen separate pits fall within our area, though the majority of them are now worked out and have been naturalised to form an attractive amenity. The materials dug from these pits was used within the construction industry, especially within the Peterborough area. They have proved particularly useful over the last decade or so, as Peterborough has grown so rapidly, with a great deal of new building and the associated roads and shopping complexes attendant on such growth.
